# Arpeggio: Major 7b5 in D (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio consists of the following notes: D, F#, A#, C. It is a Major 7b5 chord, commonly associated with jazz and is used to add color and tension to chord progressions. The arpeggio features a unique sound due to the combination of a major 7th and a diminished 5th interval.

## Notes and Intervals Breakdown
- D (Root)
- F# (Major 3rd)
- A# (Diminished 5th)
- C (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7b5 arpeggio is often used in jazz music to create tension and dissonance in a harmonic context. It adds a sophisticated and modern sound to chord progressions, enriching the harmonic texture with its unique intervals.
